bug.author: Jeffwan
bug.summary: Kfctl delete leave over application load balancer (aws)
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened: application load balancer is created by alb-ingress-controller and the time we delete kubeflow resources, alb-ingress-controller could be deleted first and ALB will not be cleaned up. The side affect is we can not tear down the cluster since there's security group and subsets in use. <denchmark-code>kfctl delete -V -f ${CONFIG_FILE} </denchmark-code>
What did you expect to happen: In order to make sure we have a smooth process, we need to explicitly delete istio-ingress object first, alb-ingress-controller will be responsible for alb clean up. After that, then we clean up kubeflow namespace. For long term, we want to create ALB aws resources first and then associate with istio-ingress, then we can delete all aws resources in platform deletion phase separately. Anything else you would like to add: [Miscellaneous information that will assist in solving the issue.] Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): v0.6.2 and v0.7.0 kfctl version: (use kfctl version): v0.6.2 and v0.7.0rc5 Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): 1.13 OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): darwin
